intro: Lonicera chrysantha f. villosa, commonly known as the hairy trumpet honeysuckle, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its distinctive, tubular, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, giving it its specific epithet "villosa." It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and streambanks. This variety is valued for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
